author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Trading Tariffs
The Trump administration is investigating using national security as the legal justification for new import tariffs on vehicles and auto parts—just as it did for tariffs on steel and aluminum in March. The Journal reports that President Trump is asking for new tariffs of as much as 25% on automobile imports after he repeatedly signaled his intention to impose such duties. The action opens yet another front in the administration’s trade battles with both allies and rivals, a confrontational approach...
